instruction: According follow APIs to create use stories for a Online MovieTicket website.

instances.input:
User Information
POST create_user() /register Create user
POST login_user() /login Login user
instances.output:
Use Case Scenario: Online Movie Ticket Booking System

Actor: User

Preconditions: The user has access to the internet and the Online Movie Ticket Booking System.

Flow of Events:

    The user opens the Online Movie Ticket Booking System and clicks on the "Register" button.
    The system presents a registration form to the user.

name: analysis_story_from_api

instruction: Use Spring + Java to create a api for
name: create_a_sample_of_spring_api

instruction: Use given-when-then and AC1,AC2,AC3... to Create use story for

instances.output:
Here's an example of a user story using the given-when-then format and AC1, AC2, AC3, etc.: Given a user who wants to browse books by genre
When the user selects a genre from the list of available genres
Then the user should be able to view a list of books filtered by the selected genre

AC1: The list of available genres should include at least five popular genres.
AC2: The book list should display the book cover image, title, author, and price.
AC3: The book list should be sorted by popularity (number of sales) by default.
AC4: The user should be able to filter the book list by price range and rating.
AC5: The user should be able to view the details of a book, including a description, reviews, and related books.
AC6: The user should be able to add a book to their cart or wish list from the book details page.
AC7: The user should be able to navigate back to the genre selection screen at any time.

name: create_a_user_story

instruction: Use graphviz format to draw C4 architecture's Container level for
name: create_c4_container_architecture

instruction:
Use follows format "User Information
POST create_user() /register Create user
POST login_user() /login Login user" to design all api for a

instances.output:
User Information
POST create_user() /register Create user
POST login_user() /login Login user

Movie Information
GET get_movies() /movies Retrieve all movies
GET get_movie(movie_id) /movie/<movie_id> Retrieve a specific movie
POST create_movie() /movie Create a new movie
PUT update_movie(movie_id) /movie/<movie_id> Update an existing movie
DELETE delete_movie(movie_id) /movie/<movie_id> Delete a specific movie

Booking Information
POST book_ticket() /booking Book a ticket
GET get_booking(booking_id) /booking/<booking_id> Retrieve a specific booking
GET get_user_bookings(user_id) /user/<user_id>/bookings Retrieve all bookings made by a user
PUT update_booking(booking_id) /booking/<booking_id>

name: design_restful_api

instruction: I working on design software system, could you design a user journal for

instances.output:
Sure, here's a possible design for a user journal for Animation and Comics:

    User registration: Users can create an account by providing their name, email address, and a password.

    Dashboard: Upon logging in, users are presented with a dashboard that displays their recent activity, such as the last project they worked on, the last comic they read, or the latest animation they watched.

    Projects: Users can create, save, and manage their animation and comic projects. Each project contains information such as the title, description, characters, scenes, and assets. Users can upload their own assets or use pre-existing ones from the software.

    Comics: Users can read and explore comics from different genres and publishers. The software can suggest comics based on the user's reading history and preferences.

    Animations: Users can watch and explore animations from different studios and genres. The software can suggest animations based on the user's viewing history and preferences.

    Social features: Users can follow other users, comment on their projects, comics, and animations, and like and share their work.

    Notifications: Users can receive notifications about new updates, comments, and likes on their projects, comics, and animations.

    Settings: Users can manage their account settings, such as their name, email, password, profile picture, and notification preferences.

    Help and support: Users can access a help center with tutorials, FAQs, and contact information for customer support.

    Feedback: Users can provide feedback on the software, suggest new features, report bugs, and rate the software.

This user journal design is just a starting point, and it can be further customized based on the specific needs and requirements of your software system.

name: design_user_journal

instruction: Use UML to design all Data Structure for

instances.output:
Sure! Here is an UML diagram representing the data structures for Animation and Comics - Payment:                                       +----------------------+
                                      |        Payment       |
                                      +----------------------+
                                      | -id: int             |
                                      | -amount: float       |
                                      | -status: PaymentStatus|
                                      | -timestamp: datetime |
                                      +----------------------+

+--------------------------+          +-----------------------+
|        PaymentStatus     |          |       PaymentMethod    |
+--------------------------+          +-----------------------+
| -status: string          |          | -method: string        |
| +PENDING: PaymentStatus  |          | +CREDIT_CARD: string   |
| +COMPLETED: PaymentStatus|          | +PAYPAL: string        |
| +FAILED: PaymentStatus   |          +-----------------------+
+--------------------------+

name: uml_java_data_structure
